answers.answer: Sorry meant to say, taking extra IRON supplements!

So sorry to hear... High risk is no joke, nor is GD or HBP. I hope everything works out for you and your delivery is smooth and both of you are healthy!!I am at risk for GD, due to PCOS.. but after pain stakingly taking the 3-hr glucose test. I passed and have no issue. I am sorry I dont have anything to advise or help with.  Hugs!!

question: We knew at the beginning of the pg I had potential to go high risk as I have high BP that could lead to preeclampsia and a history of gestational diabetes in the family.They've been checking on me more closely for the preeclampsia, but so far that looks good even though my BP is starting to rise.  All my labs there look good.However, after yesterdays appt I have been classified as high risk due to anemia and gestational diabetes.  I was told I have to start taking extra vitamin supplements for the anemia and they are referring me to a dietician for the gestational diabetes.Does anybody have any experience with either of these pg complications?
title: Officially High Risk
